definition: to try to find/to look for/to call on sb/to find/to seek/to return/to give change
coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]

sentences.english: He let another customer through while he fumbled in his pocket for money.
sentences.chinese: 於是他讓下一位顧客先付錢，他則在一邊掏兜找錢。

sentences.english: He searched his pockets for some money, when he found his wallet was lost.
sentences.chinese: 他在口袋裏找錢時，發現他的錢包丟了。

sentences.english: She told me to keep the change and make lots of money.
sentences.chinese: 她說不用找錢了自己多多地攢起來吧。

sentences.english: He searched his pockets for money.
I think you gave me too much change.
We must find money for the rent somehow (or other).
sentences.chinese: 我們總得設法找錢付房租。

sentences.english: Sadie was already digging in her pocket for the money.
sentences.chinese: 莎蒂已經開始翻口袋找錢了。

definition: to ignore/to brush off/to dismiss/to pay no attention to
to get oneself a wife/to take a daughter-in-law
to have lingering fears/trepidation remaining after a trauma (idiom)
variant of 小題大做|小题大做[xiao3 ti2 da4 zuo4]
cheerful and optimistic/in a good mood/gaily
to be furious/to fly into a terrible rage
spendthrift and foolish/sb with more money than sense
